column4: QUESTION: How can i install the linux sources (not headers) for my kernel?
theres a linux-source metapackage which installs source for your running kernel
I have already done apt-get install linux-sources but same programas when i try to compile them didn't find it. Do i have to create some specific link?
nope that should be enough is there any specific error message u get pastebin it pls
Yes http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/39496/
linux-source ya est en su versin ms reciente.
It means: already installed .
kernel 2.6.99 doesnt seem right,
It says AT LEAST
I suppose something from v4l develps
hm the latest version of linux kernel is like 2.6.26 or something
I know i have 2.6.22-12-generic
hang on im gonna download kernel source see if i have that header file yuors complain about
Ok thanks!
wow alright the thing u try to compile looking for headers in the wrong place
mmm how can i fixit it? export or something like that?
make a symbolic link from /lib/modules/2.6.22-12-generic/source/include/linux to /usr/include/linux
do cd /lib/modules/2.6.22-12-generic
sudo mkdir source
sudo ln -s /usr/include
before that last lince cd source
that should point it to the right place
Ok thanks a lot, im going to try recompile
